column4: Hello, someone here that can help me with my audio card problem?
can someone, its really pissing me off

Ok, so i installed ubuntu once, like few h ago, but while updating the whole ubuntu crashed cuz of gnome updating was broken, and i installed again and now i got bug with audiocard, i hear sound in Speakers AND my headphones.... how to make it only working on headphones?
so your speakers play when headphones are in and playing?
what kind of comp?
and what kind of audio card?
if you type lspci in terminal, your comp will tell you the audio device
standard is not a type of audio card
that is the driver
looking...is it a laptop?
https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux-source-2.6.15/+bug/11149/comments/6
that might work, but it is for Edgy...not Hardy, which I assume you are running
also read a variety of reports that say restarting works
ya, /etc/whatever
you have to be root
type sudo before the copy command
do it in terminal
in terminal, type sudo...then the command to copy the source to the destination /etc/whateverthenameis
yup
then you type it, and you get access as root
try google searching for open source drivers for your audio card
lspci
you can also type history and get all of the previous 100 commands
also, the up arrow will automatically prompt the previous command if you want to run it
